ygData.subject: Re: New Topic, Languages!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: A few good places to practice without wasting time is the boat ride from Freeport to Butcherblock Mountains and walking through the Karanas (by the river) with
ygData.messageBody:
A few good places to practice without wasting time is the boat ride from
Freeport to Butcherblock Mountains and walking through the Karanas (by the
river) with a group of people doing the same thing.

I emphasize the boat ride because it can get boring. Of course, you can
always get something to eat too. Up to you. =)

Tiresias
Servant of Erollisi Marr


----- Original Message -----
From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
To: <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 2:58 PM
Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New Topic, Languages!!!


> From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
>
> to get skill gains they have to talk ALOT in that language. What we do
> in our group is set up a button to say something, switch to whatever
> exotic language, and click click click click a few hundred times. We
> only do this while meditating/resting though.
>
> I picked up gnoll also, but didn't hear it from a PC so must have picked
> it up from the gnolls in BB. I noticed I understood the gnolls this
> weekend before I saw I had the skill in my skillset. They say some
> funny stuff sometimes.
>
> Remember to switch back to common when done! Nothing worse than yelling
> for help and people seeing "xylb!" instead of "help!".
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Shane Murphy [mailto:shanem@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 2:45 PM
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New Topic, Languages!!!
>
>
> From: "Shane Murphy" <shanem@...>
>
> How do you start learning a new Language? I have been around elves
> talking
> Elvish before, but noticed no skill gain or message.
>
>
> Tuannon
> Bristlebane
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ragnarok <gvragnarok@...>
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com <eqpaladin@onelist.com>

> >
> >Hmm... I know Common, Elvish, Tierdall, Old Erudian, Elder Tierdall,
> Gnoll,
> >Lizardman, Gnomish, Dwarvish, and a few others I can't remember. The
> only
> >one's I can truly understand are Common, Evlish, and Dwarvish.
> >
> >Tiresias
> >Servant of Erollisi Marr
> >
> >Now if I can only memmorize that many languages in real life. =)
> >
> >

> learned a
> >> not all-to-common language? And if so, what where how and why? I got
> Gnoll
> >> from a halfling who macro'd me for a good 15 mins.
> >>
> >> -Dyce
